item.title: Israeli defense chief visits U.S.; 4 men charged in Moscow concert hall attack
item.description: Israel's defense minister meets with U.S. officials today amid rising tensions between the allies. Russia charged four men with terrorism in connection to the Moscow attack that killed more than 130.

item.title: On eclipse day, hundreds of students will send up balloons for science
item.description: The NASA-backed Nationwide Eclipse Ballooning Project puts students in charge of a bold scientific endeavor to study the April 8 total solar eclipse.

item.title: How an Indianapolis teacher is using the solar eclipse to inspire her students
item.description: Indianapolis is one of several U.S. cities in the path of totality. For many students there, it's a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to witness – and be inspired by – a total solar eclipse.

item.title: A mom's $97,000 question: How was an air-ambulance ride not medically necessary?
item.description: There are legal safeguards to protect patients from big bills like out-of-network air-ambulance rides. But insurers may not pay if they decide the ride wasn't medically necessary.

item.title: Chick-fil-A will begin using some antibiotics in its chicken again
item.description: The fast food company said it will now use "no antibiotics important to human medicine" beginning in spring of this year. The company first said it would stop using antibiotics in 2014.
